channel.title: Ati x1900gt vs 8600gt?
channel.description: I got an ATI 1900GT from my brother, does anyone know if it is better than the nvidia 8600GT(512mb ddr2)?

item.title: Ati x1900gt vs 8600gt?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I’m using the 8600GT, never had any problems with it and its still running some of the new game releases on the top settings with no lag I even get about 70fps on cod4. I paid £24

Read full topic

item.title: Ati x1900gt vs 8600gt?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:11, topic:281119”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=371230.msg2812708#msg2812708 date=1244082313]

.NET should be come mandatory in Windows OS.

Microsoft would love every proprietary thing it comes up with to become a standard, luckily it doesn’t. Why would you want it to be?
[/quote]9/10 Users are going to have to download the framework to run some sort of .Net app anyway. I can’t remember the last time i have installed a windows OS and not needed to download the framework, though that partially might also be because i do some dev with .net[/quote]

Only reason I need .net is because I put the ATI card in.

Read full topic

item.title: Ati x1900gt vs 8600gt?
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:281119”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=371230.msg2805552#msg2805552 date=1243708164]
Whats wrong with the Windows ati drivers? Other than the config util requiring .net, which is an annoyance but no biggie
[/quote]

I never liked the windows ATI drivers as much as the Nvidia ones either, they always seemed more buggy and harder to configure, but the linux ones are far, far inferior.[/quote]

Not to mention a good reason to go with Nvidia for Linux is because for a while they were releasing new driver updates every two weeks…ati is around every month, or 5 weeks…

Read full topic

item.title: Ati x1900gt vs 8600gt?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I’m using the 8600GT and it is a really good cheap card. Haven’t had any problems with it, and runs most games at high quality.

Read full topic

item.title: Ati x1900gt vs 8600gt?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

According to Tom’s Hardware, the Nvidia Geforce 8600 GT is only $39.99 and the ATi X1900 GT is $159.00.

On the Benchmark test the ATI scored 2529 while the Geforce was just behind with 2228. So, if you want processing power go with the ATI however Nvidia are a better company and if you are running Linux I would advise using the 8600GT.

http://www.tomshardware.com/charts/gaming-graphics-charts-q1-2008/3DMark06-v1.0.2-HDR-SM3.0-Score,538.html

Read full topic
